Sentencas: Textured Ni-YSZ and Co-YSZ (YSZ: cubic yttria stabilized zirconia) cermets prepared by reduction of directionally solidified NiO-YSZ and CoO-YSZ oxide eutectics respectively display a self-organized microstucture formed by similar to 400 nm wide alternating lamellae of YSZ and porous metal suitable for electrochemical applications.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: The electrochemical properties of the cermets depend on their microstructure.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: We have analyzed the orientation relationships and interfaces both of the oxide composites and cermets using Scanning Electron Microscopy, Transmission Electron Microscopy, X-ray pole figures and Electron Back-Scattering Diffraction.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: In spite of the similar crystal structure, growth habits and orientation relationships of NiO-YSZ and CoO-YSZ are different.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: Also the crystallographic behaviour, when cermets are produced, differs.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: However the metal-YSZ interfaces are about the most stable ones giving good metal-ceramic adhesion.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics

Sentencas: Due to their lamellar microstructure and good metal-ceramic adhesion these composites present long-term stability at working conditions, which makes them good candidates to be used as anodes in solid oxide fuel cells or electrolyzers.
Titulo: Orientation relationship and interfaces in Ni and Co-YSZ cermets prepared from directionally solidified eutectics
